thread.title: 8 Massive Thrift Stores In New Jersey That Offers Outrageously Good Bargains
thread.title_full: 8 Massive Thrift Stores In New Jersey That Offers Outrageously Good Bargains

author: Audrey Campbell
title: 8 Massive Thrift Stores In New Jersey That Offers Outrageously Good Bargains
text:
Searching for incredible thrift stores in New Jersey with amazing deals?
These 8 enormous secondhand shops deliver fantastic bargains and unexpected treasures!
1. Gift To Earth Thrift Store (South Plainfield)
Gift To Earth isn’t just a thrift store – it’s a mission with a message.
This eco-friendly shop takes “reduce, reuse, recycle” to a whole new level.
The moment you step inside, you’ll notice how different it feels from other thrift stores.
It’s cozy and welcoming, not overwhelming like some of the bigger chains.
The store has a wonderful selection of gently used clothing that won’t break the bank.
From casual wear to business attire, they’ve got options for every style and occasion.
What makes Gift To Earth special is their commitment to sustainability.
Every purchase helps keep perfectly good items out of landfills.
It’s shopping you can feel good about!
Their book section is a hidden gem for readers.
You’ll find everything from bestsellers to rare finds at prices that make bookstore owners cry.
The volunteers who work here are super friendly and always ready to help.
They know their inventory well and can point you toward sections you might have missed.
Gift To Earth proves that small thrift stores can pack a mighty punch when it comes to selection and value.
Where: 712 Clinton Ave, South Plainfield, NJ 07080
2. 2nd Ave Thrift Superstore (Union)
When you walk into 2nd Ave in Union, your eyes might pop out of your head.
This place is ENORMOUS!
It’s like the Disneyland of thrift stores, except instead of rides, you get racks and racks of clothes.
The store is super clean and organized, which makes treasure hunting so much easier.
You won’t have to dig through messy piles to find that perfect jacket or pair of jeans.
They sort everything by size, color, and type – it’s almost too easy!
The furniture section is a gold mine for anyone looking to spruce up their home without emptying their wallet.
From sofas to dining tables, you’ll find pieces that still have plenty of life left in them.
Sometimes you’ll spot items that look brand new but cost a fraction of the original price.
Their housewares section is like a museum of cool kitchen gadgets from every decade.
Remember those avocado green appliances from the 70s?
They’ve got ’em!
Want a waffle maker shaped like Mickey Mouse?
Keep your eyes peeled!
The best part about 2nd Ave is their color tag sales.
Each week, different colored tags go on special discount.
If you time it right, you can walk out with armfuls of treasures for pocket change.
It’s like winning a shopping lottery!
Where: 2661 Morris Ave, Union, NJ 07083
3. Red White & Blue Thrift Store (Paterson)
Red White & Blue in Paterson is a thrift store with serious patriotic pride.
The building itself is massive – you could spend hours exploring every corner.
This place is famous for its incredible clothing selection that spans decades of fashion.
Want a genuine 80s windbreaker or authentic 70s bell bottoms?
This is your spot!
The store layout is smart and spacious, making it easy to navigate even on busy days.
No bumping elbows with other shoppers as you hunt for deals here!
Their furniture section is particularly impressive, with everything from vintage coffee tables to modern office chairs.
The prices will make you do a double-take – in a good way!
Red White & Blue has a fantastic rotation system, bringing out fresh merchandise daily.
This means every visit offers new discoveries and surprises.
The men’s section deserves special mention – it’s unusually large compared to most thrift stores.
Guys will actually enjoy shopping here instead of feeling like an afterthought.
Their housewares department is like a time machine through American kitchen trends.
Pyrex collectors, this place should be on your regular rotation!
The best strategy here is to come early on weekdays when they put out new items.
Early birds definitely catch the best worms at Red White & Blue!
Where: 25 McLean Blvd, Paterson, NJ 07514
4. Goodwill Store & Donation Center (Pennsauken Township)
The Goodwill in Pennsauken Township stands out with its distinctive blue-roofed building.
It’s like a lighthouse guiding bargain hunters to shore!
This location is particularly spacious, giving you plenty of room to browse without feeling cramped.
The aisles are wide, and the merchandise is well-organized by category.
Their electronics section is surprisingly robust for a thrift store.
You’ll find everything from vintage stereos to recent model DVD players, all tested and working.
The book section here is massive and meticulously organized by genre.
Bookworms could spend hours just in this corner of the store!
Goodwill’s color tag system makes finding deals even more exciting.
Each week, different colored tags go on special sale, sometimes up to 50% off.
The furniture area offers some incredible finds if you’re patient.
Quality wooden pieces often appear at prices that would make furniture stores blush.
What makes this Goodwill special is their excellent lighting and clean environment.
No squinting in dim light to check if that shirt has stains!
Related: This Enormous Antique Shop in New Jersey Offers Countless Treasures You Can Browse for Hours
Related: The Massive Used Bookstore in New Jersey Where You Can Lose Yourself For Hours
Related: The Massive Thrift Store in New Jersey that Takes Nearly All Day to Explore
The staff here are particularly helpful and friendly, always ready with a cart if you need one.
They seem genuinely happy to be working there, which creates a positive shopping vibe.
Remember that your purchases help fund Goodwill’s job training programs.
Shopping here isn’t just good for your wallet – it’s good for your community too!
Where: 5461 NJ-70, Pennsauken, NJ 08109
5. MyUnique Thrift (Union)
MyUnique Thrift in Union lives up to its name – it’s truly one-of-a-kind!
This massive store feels more like a department store than a thrift shop.
The sheer size of this place will make your jaw drop when you first walk in.
It’s thrifting on an industrial scale!
Their clothing section is organized with military precision – by size, type, and even color.
This makes finding exactly what you want so much easier than at other thrift stores.
The children’s section is particularly impressive, with toys, clothes, and books all neatly arranged.
Parents will appreciate how easy it is to find quality kids’ items at fraction-of-retail prices.
MyUnique’s housewares department could outfit an entire kitchen from scratch.
From basic pots and pans to quirky gadgets you never knew existed, they’ve got it all.
The furniture section often features quality brands at prices that seem like printing errors.
Solid wood dressers and dining sets appear regularly on the sales floor.
What sets MyUnique apart is their rigorous quality control.
You won’t find stained, ripped, or broken merchandise here – they’re picky about what makes it to the floor.
Their seasonal sections are always on point, rotating holiday decorations and seasonal items right on schedule.
Need Halloween costumes in October or Christmas decorations in December?
They’ve got you covered!
The checkout process is efficient with multiple registers open during busy times.
No standing in endless lines clutching your treasures here!
Where: 2485 US-22, Union, NJ 07083
6. 2nd Ave Thrift Superstore (Pennsauken)
The 2nd Ave in Pennsauken is like the cool cousin of the Union location.
Same family, different personality!
This store’s layout feels more open and airy than many other thrift shops.
High ceilings and wide aisles make for a pleasant shopping experience.
Their men’s suit selection is particularly noteworthy – you’ll find quality brands that would cost hundreds new.
Business attire shoppers, take note!
The shoe section here is exceptionally well-organized and extensive.
From practical sneakers to fancy dress shoes, the options seem endless.
What makes this 2nd Ave location special is their incredible turnover rate.
New merchandise hits the floor constantly throughout the day.
The dressing rooms are clean and plentiful – a rare luxury in the thrift store world.
No more holding clothes up in front of you and guessing if they’ll fit!
Their jewelry counter often has some amazing finds for those with a patient eye.
Vintage costume pieces and modern accessories appear regularly at tiny prices.
The staff here are particularly good at keeping the store tidy even during busy weekend rushes.
No messy, picked-over racks by Sunday afternoon!
Like its Union counterpart, this 2nd Ave uses a color tag discount system that rewards frequent shoppers.
The more often you visit, the more likely you’ll hit the jackpot with the right colored tags!
Where: 7533 S Crescent Blvd, Pennsauken, NJ 08109
7. Hana Mission Thrift Store (Belleville)
Hana Mission Thrift Store in Belleville proves that good things come in small packages.
This charming shop might not be as gigantic as others on our list, but it’s packed with treasures!
The storefront has a welcoming, small-town feel that instantly makes you feel at home.
It’s the kind of place where the staff might remember your name after a few visits.
What Hana Mission lacks in square footage, it makes up for in quality merchandise.
They’re selective about what they put out, so you won’t waste time sifting through junk.
Their clothing section features many name brands in excellent condition.
Fashion lovers will appreciate finding quality pieces without the mall price tags.
The store has a wonderful selection of unique home décor items that rotate frequently.
You’ll find everything from vintage picture frames to modern decorative pieces.
One of Hana Mission’s strengths is their book section, which is surprisingly extensive for a smaller store.
Bookworms can often find recent bestsellers alongside classic literature.
The store is exceptionally clean and well-organized, making it easy to spot potential treasures.
No treasure hunting headaches here!
What makes Hana Mission special is knowing your purchases support their community outreach programs.
Shopping here helps fund their important mission work.
The prices here are often lower than at larger thrift chains, making it a true bargain hunter’s paradise.
Some items are priced so low, you’ll wonder if they made a mistake!
Where: 180 Washington Ave, Belleville, NJ 07109
8. MyUnique Thrift (Elizabeth)
MyUnique Thrift in Elizabeth is the urban explorer’s dream thrift destination.
Located in the heart of the city, this massive store is a treasure trove of possibilities.
The building’s distinctive red signage makes it impossible to miss as you’re driving down the street.
It’s like a beacon calling all thrift enthusiasts!
This location is particularly known for its amazing selection of vintage clothing.
Fashion lovers can find pieces spanning several decades of style.
The store layout is thoughtfully designed with wide aisles and clear section markers.
Even first-time visitors can navigate with ease.
Their furniture department often features quality pieces at prices that seem like typos.
Solid wood dressers and dining sets appear regularly on the sales floor.
What makes the Elizabeth location special is its diverse merchandise that reflects the multicultural community.
You’ll find unique items here that rarely appear in suburban thrift stores.
The housewares section is a kitchen gadget lover’s paradise.
From basic pots and pans to specialized tools, they’ve got cooking covered.
MyUnique’s color tag discount system adds an element of excitement to every visit.
Different colored tags go on special sale each week, sometimes up to 75% off!
The children’s section is particularly impressive, with toys, clothes, and books all neatly arranged.
Parents will appreciate how easy it is to find quality kids’ items at fraction-of-retail prices.
The staff here are particularly helpful and seem to genuinely enjoy their work.
Their positive attitude makes shopping here even more pleasant.
Where: 116 Broad St, Elizabeth, NJ 07201
Thrift shopping in New Jersey isn’t just about saving money – it’s about the adventure of discovery!
These eight enormous stores offer countless opportunities to find incredible bargains that will make your wallet and your home very happy.
Happy treasure hunting!
